alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 09 at 3:56PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center. The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: NWS Las Vegas NV - CA-519 (Eastern Sierra in Inyo County) NWS Reno NV - CA-073 (Eastern Sierra in Mono County) * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is expected to rise to HIGH at all elevations this evening and possibly to EXTREME by tomorrow. Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to continue through 7 am on Sunday, March 12th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virginia Lakes to the north to Bishop Creek to the south. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 16:00 PST to Sun 07:00 PDT. * IMPACTS...Intense snowfall, rain on snow, and strong winds will overload the snowpack, which contains buried persistent weak layers. Travel will be difficult and very dangerous. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
